s.text: Dole may not win, but maybe now he won't be disgraced.
The strategy is clear and politically smart: "Let Dole Be Reagan," complete with a partner who is the original supply-sider, co-author of Reagan's 1981 Kemp/Roth tax cut.
The strategy is clear and politically smart: "Let Dole Be Reagan," complete with a partner who is the original supply-sider, co-author of Reagan's 1981 Kemp/Roth tax cut.
He had a new sense of spirit, a Reagan/Kemp tax cut.
The next scene has no distracting images, just words, numbers, and this focus: a "15 Percent Tax Cut for Every Taxpayer."
He smiled, and his color brightened to a paler Reaganism.
The absence of any reinforcing visual actually makes the simple message all the more vivid.
